data.question: What is the chemical formula for Corrole-MOF-1?
What method was used for the synthesis of 5,10,15-Tris(p-carboxylphenyl)corrole (H3TCPC)?
data.answer: The ligand H3TCPC was synthesized based on previous literatures with some modifications, involving reactions with methyl p-formylbenzoate, pyrrole, and subsequent steps including chloranil oxidation.

data.question: Is Corrole-MOF-1 stable in boiling water?
data.answer: Yes, Corrole-MOF-1 demonstrates excellent chemical stability, including stability in boiling water.

data.question: What is the BET surface area of Corrole-MOF-1 after treatment with pH = 2 aqueous solution?
What is the yield of the Hetero-Diels–Alder reaction of benzaldehyde with 2,3-dimethyl-1,3-butadiene using [Corrole-MOF-1(Fe)]BF4 as the catalyst?
Can Corrole-MOF-1 be recycled for catalytic activity?
data.answer: Yes, Corrole-MOF-1(Fe) can be recycled and maintains high catalytic activity after three cycles.

data.question: What is the crystal system of Corrole-MOF-1?
What is the role of AgBF4 in the catalytic activity test for the Hetero-Diels–Alder reaction?
data.answer: AgBF4 is used to prepare the cationic catalyst [Corrole-MOF-1(Fe)]BF4 by treating Corrole-MOF-1(Fe) with AgBF4.

data.question: Does Corrole-MOF-1 exhibit mesoporous characteristics?
data.answer: Yes, Corrole-MOF-1 exhibits mesoporous characteristics with a mesopore size of 23.4 Å.

data.question: What is the highest recorded turnover frequency (TOF) for the Hetero-Diels–Alder reaction using [Corrole-MOF-1(Fe)]BF4 as the catalyst?
What is the structural feature of Corrole-MOF-1 that contributes to its high stability?
data.answer: Corrole-MOF-1 features a rare 9-connected Zr/Hf-oxo cluster structure, contributing to its high stability.

data.question: Is Corrole-MOF-1 stable in a wide pH range?
data.answer: Yes, Corrole-MOF-1 is stable in a wide pH range, including acidic and basic conditions.

data.question: What is the Langmuir surface area of Corrole-MOF-1 after activation with acid aqueous solutions?
What is the significance of the 9-connected Zr6 cluster in Corrole-MOF-1?
data.answer: The 9-connected Zr6 cluster in Corrole-MOF-1 contributes to its unique structure and high chemical stability.

data.question: Can Corrole-MOF-1 be used for gas sorption applications?
data.answer: Yes, Corrole-MOF-1 has been demonstrated to be effective for gas sorption applications, including N2, CO2, H2, and CH4 sorption.

data.question: What is the yield of dihydropyran product 3a when using Fe(TCMPC)BF4 as the catalyst?
What is the role of supercritical CO2 drying in the preparation of Corrole-MOFs for catalytic activity tests?
data.answer: Supercritical CO2 drying is used to remove small molecules from the channels of Corrole-MOFs, optimizing them for catalytic activity tests.

data.question: Is Corrole-MOF-1 soluble in common organic solvents?
data.answer: No, Corrole-MOF-1 demonstrates excellent solvent stability, indicating it is not soluble in common organic solvents.

data.question: What is the crystallographic space group of Corrole-MOF-1?
What is the effect of pH on the N2 uptake capacity of Corrole-MOF-1?
data.answer: The N2 uptake capacity of Corrole-MOF-1 reaches its maximum when the pH of the aqueous solution used for activation is 2.
